value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-4ybWQSRcOY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

We need to use SharePoint Folder connector to load

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?

value.title: How to Easily Change the Data Source Type in Power BI
value.excerpt: Watch till the end to find out how you can switch your Power BI model without redoing a lot of work from using .csv or .xls files to directly using the SQL server.  First, I will show you the two wrong ways of changing the data source type and then I’m going to show you the right way of doing it.  For

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present
